Description: Body sherd of Attic black-figured pottery lip-cup; interior glazed black; exterior: black band at turn to lip; handle zone reserved, with inscription.
Producer name: Attributed to: Eucheiros (or another son of Ergotimos)
Excavator/field collector: Excavated by: Dr David George Hogarth
Bibliographic references: Edgar 1898/1899 / Excavations at Naukratis. B: The Inscribed and Painted Pottery (p. 55, no. 50a)
Beazley & Payne 1929 / Attic Black Figured Fragments from Naukratis (p. 267) (discussion on no. 45)
Robertson 1951 / Gordion cups from Naukratis (p. 144) (with n. 11)
Venit 1982 / Painted Pottery from the Greek Mainland found in Egypt, 640-450 BC (p. 415-6, no. B641)
Möller 2000 / Naukratis, Trade in Archaic Greece (p. 232, no. 15)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GA.0585) (Phase 1)
Acquisition name: Donated by: British School at Athens
